definition: variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex

sentences.english: The clouds lingering over the mountainside and the fog often surround us.
sentences.chinese: 云雾旋绕在山腰，自己们经常被年夜雾所覆盖。

sentences.english: Fiery formations swirl around a sunspot on the sun's turbulent surface.
sentences.chinese: 在太阳狂爆表面上，炽热物质旋绕着一个太阳黑点。

sentences.english: Apply before going to sleep following through the night out in a smoke-filled environment.
sentences.chinese: 要是1晚上都泡在烟雾旋绕的环境，建议睡前使用。

sentences.english: Their songs reverberated through the valley.
sentences.chinese: 他们的歌声在山谷中旋绕。

sentences.english: Apply forward going to your bed from overnight out in a smoke-filled environment.
sentences.chinese: 假使1早晨都泡在烟雾旋绕的环境，创议睡前使用。

definition: to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to spin rapidly/to whirl around/(of time) to fly by
silvery light/bright white light/shining white light
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
intermittent/now you see it, now you don't
